Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Simulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Constants

    public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constants
    The main class of the P3 exercise. This class is only partially complete.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface Constants

        EAST, END_IO, END_PROCESS, IO_REQUEST, NEW_PROCESS, NORTH, SOUTH, SWITCH_PROCESS, WEST

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(Queue memoryQueue,
         Queue cpuQueue,
         Queue ioQueue,
         long memorySize,
         long maxCpuTime,
         long avgIoTime,
         long simulationLength,
         long avgArrivalInterval,
         Gui gui)
        Constructs a scheduling simulator with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        memoryQueue - The memory queue to be used.
        cpuQueue - The CPU queue to be used.
        ioQueue - The I/O queue to be used.
        memorySize - The size of the memory.
        maxCpuTime - The maximum time quant used by the RR algorithm.
        avgIoTime - The average length of an I/O operation.
        simulationLength - The length of the simulation.
        avgArrivalInterval - The average time between process arrivals.
        gui - Reference to the GUI interface.

    • Method Detail

      • simulate

        public void simulate()
        Starts the simulation. Contains the main loop, processing events. This method is called when the "Start simulation" button in the GUI is clicked.

      • readLong

        public static long readLong(java.io.BufferedReader reader)
        Reads a number from the an input reader.
        Parameters:
        reader - The input reader from which to read a number.
        Returns:
        The number that was inputted.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The startup method. Reads relevant parameters from the standard input, and starts up the GUI. The GUI will then start the simulation when the user clicks the "Start simulation" button.
        Parameters:
        args - Parameters from the command line, they are ignored.
